description: Returns information about an action type created for an external provider, where the action is to be used by customers of the external provider. The action can be created with any supported integration model.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Defines what kind of action can be taken in the stage. The following are the valid values: Source Build Test Deploy Approval Invoke Compute.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: The creator of an action type that was created with any supported integration model. There are two valid values: AWS and ThirdParty.

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: The provider of the action type being called. The provider name is specified when the action type is created.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: A string that describes the action type version.

nested_items.name: actionType
nested_items.description: The action type information for the requested action type, such as the action type ID.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: The description for the action type to be updated.

nested_items.name: configuration
nested_items.description: The action configuration properties for the action type. These properties are specified in the action definition when the action type is created.

nested_items.name: lambdaExecutorConfiguration
nested_items.description: Details about the Lambda executor of the action type.

nested_items.name: lambdaFunctionArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the Lambda function used by the action engine.

nested_items.name: jobWorkerExecutorConfiguration
nested_items.description: Details about the JobWorker executor of the action type.

nested_items.name: pollingAccounts
nested_items.description: The accounts in which the job worker is configured and might poll for jobs as part of the action execution.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: pollingServicePrincipals
nested_items.description: The service Principals in which the job worker is configured and might poll for jobs as part of the action execution.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The integration model used to create and update the action type, Lambda or JobWorker.

nested_items.name: policyStatementsTemplate
nested_items.description: The policy statement that specifies the permissions in the CodePipeline customer account that are needed to successfully run an action.

nested_items.name: jobTimeout
nested_items.description: The timeout in seconds for the job. An action execution can have multiple jobs. This is the timeout for a single job, not the entire action execution.

nested_items.name: category
nested_items.description: Defines what kind of action can be taken in the stage, one of the following:
Source.
Build.
Test.
Deploy.
Approval.
Invoke.

nested_items.name: owner
nested_items.description: The creator of the action type being called: AWS or ThirdParty.

nested_items.name: provider
nested_items.description: The provider of the action type being called. The provider name is supplied when the action type is created.

nested_items.name: version
nested_items.description: A string that describes the action type version.

nested_items.name: inputArtifactDetails
nested_items.description: Details for the artifacts, such as application files, to be worked on by the action. For example, the minimum and maximum number of input artifacts allowed.

nested_items.name: minimumCount
nested_items.description: The minimum number of artifacts that can be used with the action type. For example, you should specify a minimum and maximum of zero input artifacts for an action type with a category of source.

nested_items.name: maximumCount
nested_items.description: The maximum number of artifacts that can be used with the actiontype. For example, you should specify a minimum and maximum of zero input artifacts for an action type with a category of source.

nested_items.name: outputArtifactDetails
nested_items.description: Details for the output artifacts, such as a built application, that are the result of the action. For example, the minimum and maximum number of output artifacts allowed.

nested_items.name: minimumCount
nested_items.description: The minimum number of artifacts that can be used with the action type. For example, you should specify a minimum and maximum of zero input artifacts for an action type with a category of source.

nested_items.name: maximumCount
nested_items.description: The maximum number of artifacts that can be used with the actiontype. For example, you should specify a minimum and maximum of zero input artifacts for an action type with a category of source.

nested_items.name: permissions
nested_items.description: Details identifying the accounts with permissions to use the action type.

nested_items.name: allowedAccounts
nested_items.description: A list of Amazon Web Services account IDs with access to use the action type in their pipelines.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: properties
nested_items.description: The properties of the action type to be updated.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The property name that is displayed to users.

nested_items.name: optional
nested_items.description: Whether the configuration property is an optional value.

nested_items.name: key
nested_items.description: Whether the configuration property is a key.

nested_items.name: noEcho
nested_items.description: Whether to omit the field value entered by the customer in the log. If true, the value is not saved in CloudTrail logs for the action execution.

nested_items.name: queryable
nested_items.description: Indicates that the property is used with polling. An action type can have up to one queryable property. If it has one, that property must be both required and not secret.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: The description of the property that is displayed to users.

nested_items.name: configurationUrl
nested_items.description: The URL returned to the CodePipeline console that contains a link to the page where customers can configure the external action.

nested_items.name: entityUrlTemplate
nested_items.description: The URL returned to the CodePipeline console that provides a deep link to the resources of the external system, such as a status page. This link is provided as part of the action display in the pipeline.

nested_items.name: executionUrlTemplate
nested_items.description: The link to an execution page for the action type in progress. For example, for a CodeDeploy action, this link is shown on the pipeline view page in the CodePipeline console, and it links to a CodeDeploy status page.

nested_items.name: revisionUrlTemplate
nested_items.description: The URL returned to the CodePipeline console that contains a link to the page where customers can update or change the configuration of the external action.
